metadata.title: CVE-2021-46966 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ACPI: custom_method: fix potential use-after-free issueIn cm_write(), buf is always freed when reaching the end of thefunction.  If the requested count is less than table.length, theallocated buffer will be freed but subsequent calls to cm_write() willstill try to access it.Remove the unconditional kfree(buf) at the end of the function andset the buf to NULL in the -EINVAL error path to match the rest offunction.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
